file_id.title: File ID e.g. F1
file_id.description: File to which the variable belongs

vid.title: Variable unique ID
vid.description: Unique variable ID e.g. V1, V2

var_intrvl.title: Interval type
var_intrvl.description: indicates the interval type; options are discrete or continuous.

var_dcml.title: Variable decimal points
var_dcml.description: Number of decimal points in the variable

var_wgt.title: Weight
var_wgt.description: indicates whether the variable is a weight

var_qstn_preqtxt.title: Pre-question text
var_qstn_preqtxt.description: Text describing a set of conditions under which a question might be asked.

var_sumstat.description:
One or more statistical measures that describe the responses to a particular variable and may include one or more standard summaries, e.g., minimum and maximum values, median, mode, etc. 

 The attribute 'type' denotes the type of statistics being shown: mean, median, mode, valid cases, invalid cases, minimum, maximum, or standard deviation.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type such as frequency, percent, etc

var_format.title: Variable format
var_format.description: The technical format of the variable in question. Attributes for this element include: 'type', which indicates if the variable is character or numeric; 'formatname,' which in some cases may provide the name of the particular, proprietary format actually used; 'schema,' which identifies the vendor or standards body that defined the format (acceptable choices are SAS, SPSS, IBM, ANSI, ISO, XML-data or other); 'category,' which describes what kind of data the format represents, and includes date, time, currency, or 'other' conceptual possibilities.
